Ellipsis · Get work done in chat

Ellipsis documentation.

Developer’s guide to Ellipsis.ai

Reference

The reference explains the core concepts and features of Ellipsis, a tool to perform tasks, work with data, and answer questions in chat.

Ellipsis learns how to respond using “skills”, which can be installed or created from scratch. A skill is a collection of one or more “actions” that perform a task and/or return a response. Typically, all of the actions in a skill are related in some way, by theme or by the kind of data they use.

  1. Skills
    1. Version history
    2. Title, description, and icon
    3. Installing, cloning, merging, deleting
    4. Exporting and importing
  2. Actions
    1. Triggers
    2. Inputs
    3. Node.js function
    4. Response template
    5. Testing
    6. Cloning and deleting
  3. Custom data types
  4. Libraries
  5. Node.js ellipsis object
  6. Ellipsis API
  7. Third-party APIs
  8. Environment variables

Cookbook

The cookbook focuses on specific problems you may face when building new skills, or customizing existing ones.

  1. Interfacing with external services and APIs
    1. Using async APIs
    2. Using a specific NPM package version

This project is maintained by ellipsis-ai
